Item.text: That is not the right answer.
You're on a roll! That's right!
You're on a roll! That's right!
Nice job, both of you! You are both right!
Oh no! It looks like that one tripped you both up!
It looks like you were both wrong this time.
Both of you were incorrect this time.
That is not the right answer.
_user_, you were incorrect this time. Jordan, you were right.
_user_, it looks like you were incorrect this time. Jordan, you were right.
_user_, you were wrong this time. Jordan, you were correct.
_user_, you are right! Jordan, you were wrong this time.
_user_, you were right! Jordan, you were wrong this time.
_user_, great job on this question! You were right! Jordan, you were wrong.
Hello! Good to see you today, _user_ and Jordan.
Today we are going to be talking about punctuation. We are going to talk about what the different marks mean, and how they are used in different ways.
I don't think punctuation is very important. How is it supposed to help me learn how to read and understand the words?

On the contrary, Jordan! Punctuation is crucial to reading! # It gives us incredibly important clues as to, how, to read and understand the words. # Take a close look at the chart below and see a sample of the most common punctuation marks.
Why don't we get started and you will see what I mean.
For this part of the lesson, we will be looking at some comics!

_user_ and Jordan, in this activity you will try to fill in the punctuation for a comic strip. # In each pane of the comic, you will see one punctuation mark that is missing and a blank space will be in its place.

Move your mouse over each of the answer options. When you hover over each answer option, it will fill in the blank to help you pick an answer. # Click on one of the answer options to select your answer.
This activity seems kind of fun. Let's get started.
Thanks, Jordan. I hope you and _user_ now see how important punctuation is. # Understanding what each of the punctuation marks mean can help us comprehend any text.
That makes sense. Using this chart as a guide helps me to see all the punctuation marks that there are! See you next time, _user_.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The correct punctuation mark is an exclamation point! Exclamation points are used to show excitement or a strong feeling. # This person is upset that he or she forgot the keys.

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: Please give it a try!

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan, which of these do you think is the correct mark?

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect
Answer.text: I think it is the, at sign.

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: I think it is the exclamation point.

Answer.name: AskUser
Answer.text: _user_, Click on the punctuation mark that fills in the blank.

Answer.name: AgreeswithUser
Answer.text: I think _user_ was right on this one.

Answer.name: JordanExplanation
Answer.text: Alright, I think I get it.

Answer.name: CristinaMoveOn
Answer.text: Great! Let's move on.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The correct answer is the period.

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: Don't forget to click on an answer!

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan, which punctuation mark fits in this sentence?

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect
Answer.text: I think the colon fits!

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: I am guessing it's the period.

Answer.name: AskUser
Answer.text: _user_, Click on the punctuation mark that correctly fills in the blank.

Answer.name: AgreeswithUser
Answer.text: I am thinking _user_ was right this time.

Answer.name: JordanExplanation
Answer.text: Why do we use a period here? Periods go at the end of sentences. This is frustrating and I don't like punctuation.

Answer.name: CristinaMoveOn
Answer.text: Jordan, I am going to ignore that comment for now. _user_, I bet you know why we use a period here!

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The correct answer is, the period signals an abbreviation. Abbreviations are shortened forms of words. # Another example of a common abbreviated word is mister, spelled, em, are, period.

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: Please click on an answer!

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan, why do we use a period in this position?

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect
Answer.text: I think the period is in the wrong spot.

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: I'm going to go with, the period signals an abbreviation.

Answer.name: AskUser
Answer.text: _user_, why do we use a period in this position?

Answer.name: AgreeswithUser
Answer.text: I think _user_ is right.

Answer.name: JordanExplanation
Answer.text: Oh right, I knew that. I see that all the time.

Answer.name: CristinaMoveOn
Answer.text: Exactly! See, Jordan, I told you punctuation was important!

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The correct answer is parentheses signal what acronyms stand for. Quotations signal speech. # Acronyms are formed from a group of words using the first letter of each word. # Acronyms are pronounced the same way words are. For example, Jordan, pronounce the acronym on this page.

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: Don't forget to click an answer!

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan, why do we use parentheses here instead of quotation marks?

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect
Answer.text: I think parentheses signal speech and quotations signal additional information.

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: I'm not sure, but I'm going to go with, parentheses signal what acronyms stand for and quotes signal speech.

Answer.name: AskUser
Answer.text: _user_, In this instance, why do we use parentheses instead of quotation marks?

Answer.name: AgreeswithUser
Answer.text: I agree with _user_ on this one.

Answer.name: JordanExplanation
Answer.text: It's NASA, right?

Answer.name: CristinaMoveOn
Answer.text: That's right! Let's move on to the next question.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The, at sign tell us that something is an email address. Email is a way to communicate electronically. When you sign up for an email address, you get to pick out what you want your user name to be.

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: Please click on an answer!

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan, what does the, at sign tell us?

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect
Answer.text: I think it is a phone number.

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: It tells us it's an email address!

Answer.name: AskUser
Answer.text: _user_, What does the, at signal tell us in this text?

Answer.name: AgreeswithUser
Answer.text: I'm going to have to agree with _user_.

Answer.name: JordanExplanation
Answer.text: I want my email address to say, master of grammar! I have a question. Why is the email address blue. And why is it underlined?

Answer.name: CristinaMoveOn
Answer.text: That's a great question!

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The correct answer is, it is a hyper link. Hyper links take you from one page to another on the computer. In this case, the hyper link will open a search engine.

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: Please remember to click on an answer!

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan, Why is the web address blue and underlined?

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect
Answer.text: I think it's an email address.

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: I bet it's a hyper link.

Answer.name: AskUser
Answer.text: _user_, Why is the web address, blue and underlined?

Answer.name: AgreeswithUser
Answer.text: I think _user_ is right.

Answer.name: CristinaMoveOn
Answer.text: Now, we have talked about punctuation marks that have multiple uses, but there are also different punctuation marks that have the same basic use.

Answer.name: JordanExplanation
Answer.text: Oh, OK. I am excited to know what that is called!

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The correct answer is, the colon and bulleted list. Colons and bullet points both signal to the reader that there is a list.

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: If you don't click on an answer, I can't tell what you're thinking.

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan, which of these two punctuation marks have a similar function?

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect
Answer.text: I think it's the period and the comma.

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: I think it's the colon and the bulleted list.

Answer.name: AskUser
Answer.text: _user_, which of these two punctuation marks have a similar function?

Answer.name: AgreeswithUser
Answer.text: I think _user_'s answer is correct.

Answer.name: JordanExplanation
Answer.text: I think i've seen lists that use numbers too.

Answer.name: CristinaMoveOn
Answer.text: Great observation, Jordan! There are numbered lists as well! Now that we have gotten really good at picking out the correct punctuation marks, let's talk about why some punctuation marks are wrong.

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The correct answer is, hyphens signal new meanings of combined words. # Hyphens combine words to make words with totally different meanings. Jordan, can you think of an example of one?

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: Don't forget to answer the question!

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan. why is a hyphen the incorrect punctuation mark?

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect
Answer.text: I think it's because hyphens signal questions.

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: I think hyphens signal new meanings of combined words.

Answer.name: AskUser
Answer.text: _user_, why is a hyphen the incorrect punctuation mark?

Answer.name: AgreeswithUser
Answer.text: I'm siding with _user_ on this one.

Answer.name: JordanExplanation
Answer.text: How about, mother in law? I'm pretty sure that is a hyphenated word!

Answer.name: CristinaMoveOn
Answer.text: That's right! Brilliant Jordan! So now that we know what hyphens are for, let's correct the sentence!

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The correct answer is the slash. Slashes indicate alternative words. # For example, it is common to see the words either and or with a slash between them.

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: Don't forget to click on an answer, even if you're not sure.

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan, what is the correct punctuation mark to use in this situation?

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect
Answer.text: I think it is the semi colon.

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: I am going guess the slash.

Answer.name: AskUser
Answer.text: _user_, what is the correct punctuation mark to use in this situation?

Answer.name: AgreeswithUser
Answer.text: I agree with _user_'s answer.

Answer.name: JordanExplanation
Answer.text: I keep seeing a symbol on a social media site and i'm not sure what it is.

Answer.name: CristinaMoveOn
Answer.text: Let's take a look!

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: It is being used as a hash tag! Pound Signs are used on telephones, and it is not being used to indicate a number. # Hash tags are common on social media websites. They are used to mark key words or topics of a message.

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: Remember to click on an answer!

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan, how do you think this punctuation mark is being used?

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect
Answer.text: I think it is being used as the pound sign.

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: I bet this is a hash tag!

Answer.name: AskUser
Answer.text: _user_, how is this punctuation mark being used in this instance?

Answer.name: AgreeswithUser
Answer.text: I'm thinking _user_ is right.

Answer.name: JordanExplanation
Answer.text: And all the kids are saying it these days. I hear it all the time. Hash tag, kids, hash tag, bad grammar!

Answer.name: CristinaMoveOn
Answer.text: Haha, Jordan. Yes, they have become quite popular as of late. # _user_ and Jordan, I am very impressed with your progress on this! Let's get some more practice in!

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The correct answer is the question mark. Question marks signal that the speaker does not know something, rather, they have a question.

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: Please answer the question.

Answer.name: AskJordan

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect
Answer.text: I think it is the dash.

Answer.name: JordanCorrect

Answer.name: AskUser
Answer.text: _user_, which of these is the correct answer?

Answer.name: AgreeswithUser
Answer.text: I'm going to agree with _user_ here.

Answer.name: JordanExplanation
Answer.text: Oh! Of course, it's right in the name.That one seemed pretty straight forward.

Answer.name: CristinaMoveOn
Answer.text: Good, let's go on.

Answer.text: Jordan, you're hilarious. Elipsees can be used to project sarcasm and I just used them.

Answer.text: So, You are right is a complete sentence.

Answer.name: CristinaMoveOn
Answer.text: Exactly, so we can put a period for a full stop after that sentence and move on to the next thought.

Answer.text: The correct answer is the ellipsis. Remember, elipsees tell us that the thought is incomplete.

Answer.name: BlankPrompt
Answer.text: Please click an answer.

Answer.name: AskJordan
Answer.text: Jordan, please tell us what you think the correct answer is.

Answer.name: JordanIncorrect
Answer.text: I think it is the quotation marks.

Answer.name: JordanCorrect
Answer.text: I'm going to bet on the ellipsis.

Answer.name: AskUser
Answer.text: _user_, Which punctuation mark finishes the description of the scene in the yellow box.

Answer.name: AgreeswithUser
Answer.text: I choose the same answer as _user_.

Answer.name: JordanExplanation
Answer.text: Right! I bet he let her win because it's her birthday.

Answer.name: CristinaMoveOn
Answer.text: Like her dad says, we may never know...
